metadata.synopsis: CINE ARTIST - PLEASE CONTACT WRITER RE. STRUCTURE - IT'S NOT THAT BAD, PROMISEDialog with Sarevok and his Murder Tribunal - will begin when approaching the Murder Tribunal in an underground area beneath Baldur's Gate. Sarevok will judge whether the player is worthy of receiving the title of "Unholy Assassin" - or tell the court to attack if we are deemed unworthy. If this part of the trial succeeds, the Tribunal will move on to the "Baptism of Blood" ritual (LOW_MurderTribunal_Sarevok_BloodBaptism).
metadata.how_to_trigger: - Load up GustavDev/CTY_Main_A- Go to the Murder Tribunal (goto -1284 1 504) (near S_LOW_MurderTribunal_Sarevok_ae9f784a-ea64-4297-95a7-8377e85231b6)- If you want to do the trial, use "MT_GetDolorItems" to get one of the victim's hands.- Get spotted by the members of the court (Sarevok or his three servants).- This can also be triggered by entering a checkpoint trigger.

1.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
1.text: O Hail, true Chosen. May you bring death wherever you walk.

330.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
330.text: You gaze upon your disgraced kin, those who were sacrificed where you were raised up.

135.speaker: Player
135.text: My idol, my hero, even in death.

80.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
80.text: Silence, spawn. Our undeaths are not to be admired. They are a punishment for our failures.

501.speaker: Player
501.text: Why are you pieces of jerky still alive?

456.speaker: Player
456.text: Pathetic. Too afraid to die when you should have?

342.speaker: Player
342.text: Ha. I killed Jaheira: your own slaughterer.

26.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
26.text: Exquisite. I claim afore Father that I desire all deaths equally. In my private worship, though, I have found myself turning again and again to prayers for her demise.

270.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
270.text: We honoured Bhaal with our deaths, but he dragged us into these husked forms, to bring the lash upon the Gate, and nurse his dread cult in its dormant years.

231.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
231.text: We preside over the Tribunal, which has initiated many assassins into the ranks in the Temple. Here we remain until another of our line ends time itself.

245.speaker: Player
245.text: And I will be that world-ender.

58.speaker: Player
58.text: Don't tell me I am to be tested again.

364.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
364.text: Unholy Chosen, of course you are above needing to prove yourself to the Tribunal.

41.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
41.text: But the truth of Bhaal's will remains. Any Bhaalspawn who can kill a Chosen has a hope of becoming the Chosen themselves.

309.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
309.text: I fear we must kill one another. It is Father's way. Two Children must not both leave a holy site alive.

114.speaker: Player
114.text: You don't have a hope in the Hells of defeating me.

92.speaker: Player
92.text: That's pure delusion. Bhaal would never anoint you as the Chosen, worm.

215.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
215.text: My aching bones still feel every spark of pain from the crystalline moment of my death.

97.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
97.text: Even if I cannot defeat you, perhaps at last he will let me die.

132.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
132.text: Let us die, Chosen. As only Bhaalspawn can die.

271.speaker: Player
271.text: What a treat. Just like your granddaughter was, gargling on her own blood.

76.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
76.text: I thank you for killing my granddaughter. She could not have been dispatched by better. Nor could I.

519.speaker: Player
519.text: To arms, then. In Bhaal's name.

55.speaker: Player
55.text: What trials are set upon them?

415.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
415.text: They must craft a series of kills, reaping divine tragedy and greater terror besides. At the last, an innocent must be gutted while the Tribunal judges the initiate's knife-hand.

435.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
435.text: I suppose there will not be the need for the Tribunal, now a true prophet of Bhaal has arisen again. You will name your new Unholy Assassins directly.

175.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
175.text: A pleasing thing, to see these stones stained with the blood of she who disgraced my Father.

227.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
227.text: The holy fool, who purged Bhaal's blessing and ruined their once-perfect form. Your death is a welcome offering here.

382.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
382.text: These are not aspirants. You have brought traitors of Bhaal into our midst.

464.speaker: Jaheira
464.text: Does it hurt, Sarevok? To be confronted with yet another of your brood who is not so desperate for daddy's attention as you are?
464.context: NodeContext: Scornful, pride in player - who is also a child of Bhaal, but rejects their evil heritage

291.speaker: Player
291.text: What fate does Bhaal have in store for me?

188.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
188.text: Fate is written, and I have read it... you shall know soon enough.

117.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
117.text: Know that while I sit here in this husk, and in every moment, experience the crystalline pain of the moment of my death.

182.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
182.text: But my fate is a paradise, compared to the one Father has in store for you.

523.speaker: Player
523.text: Why are you pieces of jerky still alive?

292.speaker: Player
292.text: Pathetic. You worship death, yet have come back to life.

219.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
219.text: You were the greatest hope we had for centuries...

167.speaker: Player
167.text: You're out of luck. Bhaal's hold over me is gone.

124.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
124.text: His ire may be quiet now, and you may not have become his brutal prophet.

21.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
21.text: But the line is not ended... You carry him with you, deep within. In your Divine Essence.

506.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
506.text: We have both failed Bhaal, let us die again, this time by each other's hands in his holy site. Each breath you take is an insult to him.

392.speaker: Player
392.text: You're out of luck. I have escaped Bhaal's will.

320.speaker: Player
320.text: I defeated Orin. You are nothing.

313.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
313.text: You sacrificed your kin, the most sacred act a Bhaalian could conduct, and summoned him with her blood.

397.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
397.text: Just to mingle your pissing fear with her gall-puddle. There are no words for this blasphemy.

403.speaker: Player
403.text: I will save this city. A Bhaalspawn can have a true heart.

284.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
284.text: It may not be this decade, may not be this century, but a true Spawn, our Dread Father incarnate, will one day be born, and will destroy this city.

242.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
242.text: A pleasing thing, to see these stones stained with the blood of he who disgraced my Father.

307.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
307.text: The weakest worm of a Bhaalspawn, the holy fool. Whelp, know that Bhaal has a worse fate in stall for you than you could ever fear.

363.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
363.text: Walk well in the Dread Lord's bloody footsteps.

467.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
467.text: You gaze upon Murder's progeny, child.

98.speaker: Echo of Illasera
98.text: Prodigal servants, each returned to do his bidding eternally.

336.speaker: Narrator
336.text: *In years past you brought this man low - foiled his plot to become a god. Now you stand before him, once again. Sarevok Anchev.*

59.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
59.text: Harper worm... the abdicating hero... your keen sense for this city has withered in your absence.

122.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
122.text: And you... Man of Stone. As you stood a statue, a helpless ornament, your city warped. Changed. Became ripe for the plucking.

457.speaker: Player
457.text: Sarevok, Bhaal's least favourite son. Still tied to daddy's apron strings, I see.

32.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
32.text: Your face bears the marks of many years, Jaheira. Your wit, however, does not.

194.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
194.text: You were never more to my Father than a stinging insect - irritating, but irrelevant. And yet you still scrabble for his attention.

87.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
87.text: You are unworthy of Bhaal's presence, let alone his trial.

107.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
107.text: But for one purpose you are fit indeed - you will make a fine offering to the Murder Lord.

346.speaker: Player
346.text: While you wriggled 'neath the city's soil like the worm that you are. It will please my hamster to kill you twice, Sarevok.

162.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
162.text: You are as stupid as I recall, man of stone.

404.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
404.text: As you stood a statue, Stone Lord, a helpless ornament, your city changed. Warped. Became ripe for the plucking.

236.speaker: Narrator
236.text: *Though this city is not your home, this man's infamy is known to you, and his presence sparks dread in the pit of your stomach.*

386.speaker: Narrator
386.text: *Before you is Sarevok Anchev - a Bhaalist who almost brought Baldur's Gate to ruin a century ago.*

193.speaker: Narrator
193.text: *Devella was right. Not just an imitator, but Sarevok himself.*

116.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
116.text: This is the court of the Dread Lord's tribunal. I am its custodian.

440.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
440.text: Here come those who seek to transcend. Aspirants of his most profane order - the would-be Unholy Assassins of Bhaal.

324.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
324.text: But these are not aspirants. You have brought traitors of Bhaal into our midst.

30.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
30.text: Harper worm... the abdicating hero... your keen sense for this city has withered in your absence.

308.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
308.text: And you... Man of Stone. As you stood a statue, a helpless ornament, your city warped. Changed. Became ripe for the plucking.

221.speaker: Jaheira
221.text: Sarevok, Bhaal's least favourite son. Still tied to daddy's apron strings, I see.

10.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
10.text: You disappoint me, child of Murder. I expected more of your return.

240.speaker: Narrator
240.text: *Sarevok Anchev. A relic of your cursed line, a Bhaalspawn who failed to become Chosen.*

101.speaker: Narrator
101.text: *Sarevok Anchev. A Bhaalspawn who failed to become Chosen, long ago. A spilled stain of Father's Divine Essence left out to dry.*

468.speaker: Narrator
468.text: *And yet, the history he shares with your companion seems to run almost as deep as your own.*

407.speaker: Narrator
407.text: *The history they share may be long gone, but the threat of violence between them is as fresh as newly spilled blood - neither party will let the other walk out of here alive.*

267.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
267.text: What purpose do you have in bringing these heretics to the court of Bhaal? Speak, or death will be your final word.

277.speaker: Player
277.text: Wait, how do you know each other?

485.speaker: Player
485.text: Wait, how do you know each other?

136.speaker: Player
136.text: Wait, how do you know each other?

371.speaker: Minsc
371.text: Simple. We beat him about the brow and butt until he was dead.
371.context: NodeContext: No nonsense. Distastefully and bluntly telling the player how you know Sarevok.

74.speaker: Jaheira
74.text: Sarevok once fancied himself Bhaal's Chosen, until we put him in his place. Feel no shame for forgetting him - history shall do the same.
74.context: NodeContext: Jeering, has absolutely no time for Sarevok

134.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
134.text: These two have long meddled in my affairs - and my father's.
134.context: NodeContext: 'These two' refers to Minsc and Jaheira

256.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
256.text: This one has long meddled in my affairs - and my father's.

27.speaker: Player
27.text: We're not here to dig up old feuds. I seek a path to the Temple of Bhaal.

316.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
316.text: You speak of the past - I speak of the future. Well, aspirant? Do the shades of yesterday speak for you, too?

473.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
473.text: There are two paths to the Temple of Bhaal: to carve your devotion into flesh, or to be the carcass that is carved upon.

44.speaker: Player
44.text: I answer for myself, Sarevok - and Minsc and Jaheira answer to me. They won't be a problem.

450.speaker: Jaheira
450.text: You make promises that aren't yours to keep. Take care that their breaking does not break something more.

201.speaker: Minsc
201.text: If Minsc is certain of one thing, it is that he very much plans on being a problem for Sarevok.

474.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
474.text: I know these two well. I have travelled in their company. Whatever else may be said of them, they answer to no one but themselves.

138.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
138.text: I know this one well. I have travelled in her company. Whatever else may be said of her, she answers to no one but herself.

359.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
359.text: It seems there is some disagreement on who is master here.

360.speaker: Player
360.text: You follow me. You dare question the SLAYER-LORD?

487.speaker: Player
487.text: Do you dare doubt me? The child of Bhaal himself? ON YOUR KNEES, FILTH.

54.speaker: Jaheira
54.text: Is it to be death, then? A better alternative to watching this sick family reunion.
54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira bows before Sarevok, annoyed with the player.NodeContext: Irritated, disappointed

463.speaker: Minsc
463.text: You have shown us the colour of your blood. Boo wonders if we had been wiser to spill it on the ground.
463.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc bows before Sarevok, surprised and sad.NodeContext: Minsc bows before Sarevok, surprised and sad.

189.speaker: Player
189.text: I'll prove it to you, Sarevok. ON YOUR KNEES, FILTH.

20.speaker: Jaheira
20.text: Only because I can no longer bear to look you in the eye.
20.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira bows before Sarevok, annoyed with the player.NodeContext: Despite yourself, the player has intimidated you into bowing before an old enemy. Irritated, won't be cowed long

406.speaker: Minsc
406.text: I would prefer to stoop over Sarevok's corpse.
406.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc bows before Sarevok,NodeContext: Quietly fuming, bowing because he was forced to

250.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
250.text: I never thought I'd see this. The Harper and the idiot ranger brought to their knees before me.

65.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
65.text: I never thought I'd see this. The Grand Harper, brought to her knees before me.

461.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
461.text: The violence pleases Bhaal. The domination pleases me. Your slaves may stand, the better to bear witness.

187.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
187.text: You are something truly glorious, child.

314.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
314.text: But for all your zeal, I sense something... amiss. You stand to be judged as an Unholy Assassin - and yet you bring no offering?

31.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
31.text: You have earned the right to stand before Bhaal's tribunal.

293.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
293.text: I never thought I'd see this. The Rashemen wanderer brought to his knees before me.

327.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
327.text: Such stillness. Such nobility. Unmarked by your command.

422.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
422.text: Your hubris is quite incredible - but it is your undoing, as it was once mine.

339.speaker: Player
339.text: Gesture for a kneel: an act, to see this sham of a ceremony through.

405.speaker: Jaheira
405.context: CinematicNodeContext: Jaheira bows before Sarevok.NodeContext: Sigh as you kneel, pretending to be a slave and hating it

417.speaker: Minsc
417.text: Order, and Minsc obeys. As if Boo himself commanded.
417.context: CinematicNodeContext: Minsc bows before Sarevok.NodeContext: Through gritted teeth - playing along with an act you hate

17.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
17.text: You wished to deceive Sarevok and your allies? The intent pleases, but the execution lacks finesse.

373.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
373.text: Your hubris has gained the better of you, as mine once did of me. But no more of this act.

295.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
295.text: They will not bend to your will. No matter - it will be my pleasure to break you, instead. In my Father's name.

40.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
40.text: She will not bend to your will. No matter - it will be my pleasure to break you both, instead. In my Father's name.

60.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
60.text: He will not bend to your will. No matter - it will be my pleasure to break you both, instead. In my Father's name.

459.speaker: Player
459.text: Fine, Sarevok. If they won't obey - take them as offerings instead.

311.speaker: Player
311.text: Fine, Sarevok. If she won't obey - take her as my offering instead.

171.speaker: Player
171.text: Fine, Sarevok. If he won't obey - take him as my offering instead.

379.speaker: Minsc
379.text: Minsc politely declines your offer to be an offering. I am afraid he is already claimed by Boo.
379.context: NodeContext: Grim - we've just offered him to Sarevok as a sacrifice. He's going to fight to the death.

522.speaker: Jaheira
522.text: You toss allies aside so easily, after everything? If you are so eager to join this worm, then may you both be buried here together.
522.context: NodeContext: First line is bitter realization. Then grim resignation - she's getting ready to fight us to the death.

150.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
150.text: This is a sacrifice my father has long lusted for. But it is not the giving of their lives that will please Bhaal - it is the taking.

51.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
51.text: The Tribunal bears witness, aspirant - do not disappoint us.

181.speaker: Player
181.text: No fooling you, Sarevok. We were actually just deciding which of us should get to kill you.

362.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
362.text: I know this one well. I have travelled in his company. Whatever else may be said of him, he answers to no one but Boo.

388.speaker: Player
388.text: I answer for myself, Sarevok - and Minsc answers to me. He won't be a problem.

69.speaker: Player
69.text: I answer for myself, Sarevok - and Jaheira answers to me. She won't be a problem.

410.speaker: Player
410.text: I brought these two here as offerings for Bhaal.

413.speaker: Player
413.text: I brought Minsc here as an offering for Bhaal.

192.speaker: Player
192.text: I brought Jaheira here as an offering for Bhaal.

18.speaker: Player
18.text: We'll find a third way. Would you two like to kill the old man, or shall I?

225.speaker: Player
225.text: We'll find a third way. Would you like to kill the old man, Jaheira, or shall I?

106.speaker: Player
106.text: We'll find a third way. Would you two like to kill the old man, Minsc, or shall I?

246.speaker: Jaheira
246.text: Do not parley with this madman.

253.speaker: Jaheira
253.text: Sarevok reclaimed his soul, once - and he still traded it back to his father for a pat on the head. He has earned his second death even more than his first.

361.speaker: Minsc
361.text: Let us pave our own path. Starting with the kicked buttocks of that one there.

479.speaker: Minsc
479.text: Sarevok once had his chance to taste of goodness - but he spat it back out. Now he may taste boot-leather instead.

212.speaker: Player
212.text: Would you two like to kill the old man, or shall I?

249.speaker: Jaheira
249.text: You get to my age, you have already done everything. Be my guest.

286.speaker: Minsc
286.text: We have already smashed Sarevok's soul from his body once. Boo says it is your turn.

272.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
272.text: And so the Harper and the idiot ranger raise their weapons against Sarevok once more.

310.speaker: Player
310.text: Would you like to kill the old man, Jaheira, or shall I?

169.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
169.text: And so the Grand Harper raises her weapons against Sarevok once more.

4.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
4.text: You disappoint me, child of Bhaal. I had heard such tales of you - tales of grandeur, and vile glory.

140.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
140.text: But the company you keep has tainted you, and pulled you from our Father's grace.

282.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
282.text: I understand. I once fell to hubris, as you are falling now. But no more.

521.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
521.text: Bhaal will never again have cause to question my devotion.

143.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
143.text: You will die as you have lived, a heretic, forgotten, and unloved. Blood to blood is Bhaal's sacrifice. And I shall be the knife that spills it.

93.speaker: Player
93.text: Would you like to kill the old man, Minsc, or shall I?

72.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
72.text: And so the idiot ranger raises his weapon against Sarevok once more.

427.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
427.text: Your hubris will be your undoing, as it was once mine.

91.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
91.text: Only this time you will fall. And Bhaal will have his offering - by my hand.

224.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
224.text: What purpose do you have in bringing this heretic to the court of Bhaal? Speak, or death will be your final word.

299.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
299.text: As you stood a statue, Stone Lord, a helpless ornament, your city changed. Warped. Became ripe for the plucking.

113.speaker: Minsc
113.text: While you wriggled 'neath the city's soil like the worm that you are. It will please my hamster to kill you twice, Sarevok.

183.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
183.text: But you are no mere aspirant. I did not expect to see you again. So it is true. You have returned.

328.speaker: Narrator
328.text: *Sarevok Anchev. A relic of your cursed line, a Bhaalspawn who failed to become Chosen.*

508.speaker: Player
508.text: You seem to know me. Have we met before?

49.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
49.text: In times past I was Bhaal's Deathbringer - his acolyte. And you, his favourite child.

88.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
88.text: You worshipped Him the way that he would wish - your blood-lust innate, your thirst for butchery unslakable.

511.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
511.text: But you were foolish enough to think yourself untouchable. You didn't see Orin rising through the ranks.

180.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
180.text: You were blinded by her artistry, her devotion - you believed she worshipped you as much as all the others.

493.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
493.text: Your fall was as spectacular as your birth - the purest Bhaalspawn there ever was, ruined by their own hubris.

218.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
218.text: But now, you have returned. Tell me, are you here to have your vengeance on my granddaughter?

66.speaker: Player
66.text: I've come to slay her. Where is she?

48.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
48.text: I see why Orin spoke of you with daggered spite.

451.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
451.text: But this is not her dwelling place. Orin resides within our Father's Temple.

34.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
34.text: She is the child of my child, and your blood kin.

504.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
504.text: But she only seeks the Bhaalian favour you were born to inherit.

239.speaker: Player
239.text: If I don't recall my past, what need have I of vengeance?

495.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
495.text: Orin only seeks the Bhaalian favour you were born to inherit.

234.speaker: Player
234.text: No, Sarevok - I am here to slay you.

446.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
446.text: O noisome Child, it would bring waves of enlightened rapture to duel you, but it is impossible now.

505.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
505.text: I have already been sacrificed, centuries ago, upon Bhaal's own graven altar. I am now but a shadow of my former self.

445.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
445.text: Orin is the one you seek to butcher. She only seeks the Bhaalian favour you were born to inherit.

356.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
356.text: She may have usurped you once, but all her rites and rituals will never match her to your natural gift.

350.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
350.text: Bhaal is about to name a new Chosen. All is between you and my granddaughter Orin now, and Orin has much to learn.

159.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
159.text: Our lord does not care for beauty. Bhaal cares only for death. Death in numbers. Death in droves.

115.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
115.text: It is a lesson Orin will only learn in death. I wonder if you will be the one to teach her?

157.speaker: Player
157.text: She has already challenged me herself. We will duel to the death.

226.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
226.text: She seeks to sacrifice you in our Father's temple.

230.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
230.text: She dreams that your corpse will be her masterpiece, but she forgets - before your incident, you were the true master.

429.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
429.text: You were murder. Pure murder. No excesses. No pretentions.

209.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
209.text: I believe you will be the one to slay Orin.

331.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
331.text: And when you do, remember grandfather Sarevok. Remember how he helped you. Return to visit him, and tell the blood-drenched tale of your victory.

323.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
323.text: But you will need my help.

165.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
165.text:
I see you have not embraced your birthright yet. Perhaps with my stewardship,
Father will bless you yet.

358.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
358.text: And when he does, remember grandfather Sarevok. Remember how he helped you. Return to visit him, and tell the blood-drenched tale of your victory.

419.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
419.text: Before you may return to our Father's fold, I must first ensure that you remain as pure and worthy of his blessing as you once were.

449.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
449.text: So I ask -  why have you brought no offering, child of Bhaal? How am I to lead you in his worship, if you abstain from his most blessed sacrement?

424.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
424.text: Before you may return to our Father's fold, I must first ensure that you remain as pure and worthy of his blessing as you once were.

137.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
137.text: Come, child of Murder, let me lead you in Bhaal's worship.

497.speaker: Player
497.text: I am the very Spawn of Bhaal. I need no leading.

283.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
283.text: Forgive me, child of Bhaal. I forget myself.

139.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
139.text: We have a sacrifice prepared for you, child of Murder. Let us celebrate your becoming.

260.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
260.text: I sense truth to your words - arrogance, too. Bhaal's children must also learn from him. I had to.

365.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
365.text: You must be tested, Child. It is Bhaal's will.

376.speaker: Player
376.text: But I do bring an offering, Sarevok. You've already met Minsc and Jaheira.

142.speaker: Player
142.text: But I do bring an offering, Sarevok. You've already met Jaheira.

296.speaker: Player
296.text: But I do bring an offering, Sarevok. You've already met Minsc.

290.speaker: Player
290.text: I will not worship Bhaal. Though I am his spawn, he is no father of mine.

206.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
206.text: Do you hear that, child? The bloodless vacuum where your Father's love for you should be. You have disappointed him.

273.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
273.text: You will make a fine offering to the Lord of Murder - his own blood, returned to him, freed of its ungrateful flesh.

516.speaker: Player
516.text: Wrong, Sarevok. I will lead his worship - you will be my offering to Bhaal.

418.speaker: Player
418.text: I'll happily challenge her. Where is she?

94.speaker: Player
94.text: I came here to become an Unholy Assassin, not to clean up after your offspring, Sarevok.

67.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
67.text: And yet you share a Father - her relation to you is as strong as it is to me, blood kin. Perhaps stronger.

266.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
266.text: I have heard of the duel Orin proposed to you. She seeks to sacrifice you in our Father's temple.

109.speaker: Player
109.text: If you think she needs to be taught a lesson, why don't you teach her yourself?

255.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
255.text: We fought already. She bested me, humiliated me, enclosed me in this chamber with Bhaal's unending disappointment. I am a failure to Him.

90.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
90.text: But you - your blood is purer than mine ever was. He made you himself. The perfect killer.

526.speaker: Player
526.text: You want me to kill your own granddaughter?

202.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
202.text: She wronged me. In killing her, you honour our Father with a eulogy of blood.

195.speaker: Player
195.text: I shall gladly step aside for Orin. I have no interest in pursuing Bhaal's favour.

352.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
352.text: Why do you speak such heresy, child? Bhaal may favour you yet. You are the true inheritor after all.

108.speaker: Player
108.text: Tell me of my past, I wish to know it.

19.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
19.text: I have heard it said you lost your memories. Let me revive them.

203.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
203.text: You were once Bhaal's favourite. You worshipped Him the way that he would wish - your blood-lust innate, your thirst for butchery unslakable.

335.speaker: Player
335.text: Are you the one behind the murders in the city?

447.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
447.text: The murders are a test. One that you would once have excelled in, but it is not for you.

444.speaker: Player
444.text: I wish to become an Unholy Assassin - show me the way.

395.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
395.text: Patience, child. Our Father has much in store for you.

502.speaker: Narrator
502.text: *Sarevok Anchev. A Bhaalspawn who failed to become Chosen, long ago. A spilled stain of Father's Divine Essence left out to dry.*

13.speaker: Narrator
13.text: *Is he your cousin? Great-uncle? Brother, even? Bhaal's bilious waters are always a little murky.*

210.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
210.text: But you do not belong here. You have brought no offering. You are not fit to be judged.

9.speaker: Player
9.text: I do not murder innocents. I save them.

368.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
368.text: Your failure is known to the Lord of Murder. Your sentence is decreed.

205.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
205.text: Come, dread sisters. Let us make a sacrifice of this pretender, for Bhaal will have his offering.

16.speaker: Player
16.text: I couldn't bring myself to harvest body parts. Not even for a god.

126.speaker: Player
126.text: What offering was I supposed to bring?

421.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
421.text: It matters not, for you have entered empty-handed. Your sentence is decreed.

222.speaker: Player
222.text: Debasing Bhaal's enemies wasn't enough? Fine. Let Minsc and Jaheira be my offerings.

302.speaker: Player
302.text: Debasing Bhaal's enemies wasn't enough? Fine. Let Jaheira be my offering.

285.speaker: Player
285.text: Debasing Bhaal's enemies wasn't enough? Fine. Let Minsc be my offering.

354.speaker: Player
354.text: Does the fact that I killed Bhaal's own Chosen - Orin - not count for anything?

3.speaker: Player
3.text: Orin sent me here to be baptised by Bhaal. Does her word count for nothing?

465.speaker: Player
465.text: I can make an offering right now by killing you.

42.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
42.text: Slow thy tongue, dread sister of mine. This pretender would foist itself upon us willingly, ill-met, but no stranger to slaughter.

513.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
513.text: Let us make a sacrifice of it, for Bhaal will have his offering.

12.speaker: Player
12.text: Sarevok Anchev. How are you still alive?

104.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
104.text: A long while ago, my wretched sibling brought me back. The fairest of Bhaalspawn, soul-bound me to this husk.

340.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
340.text: Worship death though I do, I refused it. I roamed the Coast, gathering those who still held Bhaal in their black hearts.

53.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
53.text: The cult survived, festering beneath the city, with me as the Gate's everlasting poison.

112.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
112.text: But no more. For poison is too slow a death. Now is the time for slaughter.

349.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
349.text: With these killings, the glory of the Bhaalists has risen beyond what we dreamed possible during those dark days.

514.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
514.text: But the worship of my Lord is led by another now - my granddaughter, Orin.

220.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
220.text: The youngest Unholy Assassin ever to follow in Bhaal's bloody trail. And his Chosen.

318.speaker: Player
318.text: What does Orin have to do with the murders in the city?

416.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
416.text: She is the architect of Bhaal's design.

269.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
269.text: My very blood, and by extension, His.

155.speaker: Player
155.text: How does it feel to be surpassed by your own grandchild?

149.speaker: Player
149.text: I'm looking for Orin. Is she here?

176.speaker: Player
176.text: I'm looking for Orin. Where can I find her?

24.speaker: Player
24.text: I'd like to meet Orin. Where can I find her?

127.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
127.text: She worships at the heart of Bhaal's domain - the temple of our Lord.

381.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
381.text: Bhaal has never had a more gifted prodigy.

152.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
152.text: Orin's gift surpassed even her mother's. Her mother knew this, and she could not bear it.

431.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
431.text: When Orin was but seven years old, she tried to smother the child as an offering to our Lord.

244.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
244.text: I heard the screams, I ran to help, afeared for the child's life. But the cries were not Orin's.

389.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
389.text: It was her mother's blood that soaked the sheets. Orin had cut off the very hand that tried to end her, and made a plaything of it.

146.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
146.text: And as she toyed with her dead mother's hand, a deep quiver rose up through her throat - the Lord of Murder speaking through the child.

399.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
399.text: 'Lay not a finger on this child,' he said, 'nor let any other, for this child will serve me with unholy ardour. Protect her, in my name.'

47.speaker: Player
47.text: That's horrible. No child should have to go through that.

22.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
22.text: This was Orin's tribunal. She was judged, and she was found exceptional.

111.speaker: Player
111.text: Did you know that your daughter was planning to kill Orin?

496.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
496.text: I knew of my daughter's ambitions, but not the lengths to which she'd go.

75.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
75.text: She hungered for Bhaal's favour more than anyone I'd ever known. But her daughter, Orin, hungered even more.

343.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
343.text: But Orin is not the subject of our judgement here today.

25.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
25.text: You wish to become an Unholy Assassin of Bhaal. So, approach and be judged.

0.speaker: Player
0.text: I am ready to be judged.

500.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
500.text: Our Father does not feel pride. He bore the disgrace of creating life in his Spawn. We can but atone for the shame of birth.

333.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
333.text: You misunderstand the Lord of Murder. He is not proud. He simply is.

86.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
86.text: Spirit of the slaughtered - return to us.

213.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
213.text: Show us the achievements this child has accomplished in thy unholy name.

119.speaker: Echo of Amelyssan
119.context: CinematicNodeContext: The non-sarevok members of the tribunal lend their powers to sarevok - perhaps one hand to the temple, one outstretched towards sarevok?

469.context: CinematicNodeContext: Sarevok reaches out his hand, and clenches it as though grasping something tight. He pulls the hand back towards himself, and a roiling, miasma of dark magic streams from off stage into a large cloud in front of the tribunal

492.context: CinematicNodeContext: the cloud of dark energy clears. The spectre of our previous victim stands before the player. It is confused, scared, and tries to speak, but no noise escapes.

5.speaker: GROUP_Emperors
5.text: Can it be - Belynne herself, reduced to a spectre...
5.context: NodeContext: telepathic, voice in head only

247.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
247.text: You took this spirit's life, and thus, its voice. So, speak for it. How was this pitiable creature slain?

391.speaker: Player
391.text: First, I ended its sorry existence. Then, I cut the hand from its corpse.

28.speaker: Player
28.text: The deed is done - the details don't matter.

147.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
147.text: The details are everything. Anyone can kill - not everyone can make murder an act of worship.

214.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
214.text: I would have thought you understood that, Bhaalspawn. I am disappointed.

177.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
177.text: You shrink from that which you should revel in. Your devotion to your Father is wanting.

402.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
402.text: You shrink from that which you should revel in - it is in revelry that your devotion to the Lord of Murder is known.

232.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
232.text: An Unholy Assassin of Bhaal has victims, not adversaries.

430.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
430.text: A victim does not know honour, a victim knows terror and pain.

35.speaker: Player
35.text: First, I ended its sorry existence. Then, I cut the hand from its corpse.

300.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
300.text: You bear his blood well, child. Your offering pleases Father.

357.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
357.text: You are ripe for rebirth in his unholy name.

73.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
73.text: We have a sacrifice prepared for you, child of Murder. Let us celebrate your becoming.

164.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
164.text: Your offering pleases Lord Bhaal. Your words delight him.

367.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
367.text: You slaughter well, aspirant. You are deemed - worthy.

471.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
471.text: Enter the Dread Lord's abattoir, and submit to his will.

198.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
198.text: Your words stumble. They hesitate. You lie.

486.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
486.text: You will make a most beautiful offering to the Lord of Murder.

512.speaker: Player
512.text: Slowly and painfully. I savoured every scream.

510.speaker: Player
510.text: With a smile on my face, and pleasure in my heart.

184.speaker: Player
184.text: First, I ended its sorry existence. Then, I cut the hand from its corpse.

433.speaker: Player
433.text: Slowly and painfully. I savoured every scream.

525.speaker: Player
525.text: With a smile on my face, and pleasure in my heart.

36.speaker: Player
36.text: With a smile on my face, and pleasure in my heart.

160.speaker: Player
160.text: Slowly and painfully. I savoured every scream.

200.speaker: Player
200.text: I didn't kill this person. But I will kill you.

217.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
217.text: Show us the truth of this murderer's intent, and let us judge them for their bloody service.

81.speaker: Player
81.text: What does this judgement involve exactly?

251.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
251.text: There is no better mirror in which to see the true nature of a killer than their victim.

491.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
491.text: You took their hands from them. Now, I will clutch one of their souls from the Abyss that they may show Bhaal who you are.

398.speaker: Player
398.text: I have no interest in being judged by Bhaal.

509.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
509.text: This is where you reveal yourself.

426.speaker: Player
426.text: I'll approach and take your head, monster.

466.speaker: Player
466.text: Your granddaughter killed your daughter? Your family sounds deeply disturbed.

78.speaker: Player
78.text: I can see why Bhaal chose Orin.

96.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
96.text: Bhaal's reasons are not for us to question.

353.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
353.text: My Lord made his choice - I abided by his words.

329.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
329.text: And so it is that Orin now leads his Temple, and draws aspirants to his creed.

280.speaker: Player
280.text: You should have killed Orin for what she did.

64.speaker: Player
64.text: I didn't come here to become embroiled in your family drama - I came here to be baptised by Bhaal.

315.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
315.text: Very well. Then approach, and be judged.

515.speaker: Player
515.text: That's quite a story. Shame I had to kill Orin.

394.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
394.text: You? You have slain Bhaal's Chosen?

259.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
259.text: Then your devotion to the Murder Lord is unparalleled. And I am in your debt. For you have done me a great service. You have cleared the way for my return.

494.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
494.text: I will be the Dread Lord's Chosen once again. And you will be my offering.

408.speaker: Player
408.text: I don't care about Orin - I came here to be baptised by Bhaal.

237.speaker: Player
237.text: I know Orin. I killed her.

52.speaker: Player
52.text: Are you the reason there are so many murders in the city?

263.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
263.text: In times past I was Bhaal's Deathbringer - his acolyte. But no more.

103.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
103.text: My Lord has a new favourite now. My granddaughter, Orin.
103.context: NodeContext: with resentment - he thinks the Chosen should be him

133.speaker: Player
133.text: I want to become an Unholy Assassin. What must I do?

158.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
158.text: A test. To prove your worth to Bhaal.

37.speaker: Player
37.text: Orin sent me here to be baptised by Bhaal. What must I do?

488.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
488.text: My granddaughter sent you? A  rapturous endorsement indeed, for she is the Murder Lord's new favourite.

68.speaker: Player
68.text: What exactly is an Unholy Assassin?

46.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
46.text: A servant to the cause. A master of the craft.

411.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
411.text: They are the executioners of Bhaal's will, and slaughter in His name.

261.speaker: Player
261.text: I already killed Orin, what more must I do?

443.speaker: Player
443.text: What does this have to do with the murders in the city?

125.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
125.text: That is not for you to question.

241.speaker: Player
241.text: Then what purpose do you serve, Sarevok?

507.speaker: Player
507.text: I have no business with Bhaal, I'll leave.

148.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
148.text: You are mistaken. An offering must be made.

355.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
355.text: The Dread Lord will have his tribute - the blood spilled will be yours.

472.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
472.text: A pleasing thing, to see these stones stained with the blood of those who disgraced my Father.

207.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
207.text: I know my like, child of Bhaal - but I needed to see you slaughter, first. To take life and revel in it.

499.speaker: Sarevok Anchev
499.text: Are you here to have your vengeance on my granddaughter, Orin?
